artist: Artist: Yoshikawa Kanpō; Publisher: Satō Shōtarō; Carver: Maeda Kentarō; Printer: Ōiwa Tokuzō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of young girl with ornamented updone hair, wearing a blue and white floral kimono and tan, purple and green patterned obi; silver ground
inscription: 大正十一年初夏 {Taishō jūichinen shoka}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
portfolio: From Creative Prints by Kanpō, First Collection (Kanpō sōsaku hanga, dai isshū 観方創作版画第壱集)
text:
Hinazō was a maiko, an apprentice geisha, typically associated with Kyoto where Yoshikawa Kanpō was born and lived.
Third print in a series of six.
title: Five, Hinazō
